newsitem.title: USA: API says U.S. crude stocks rose in week.
newsitem.headline: API says U.S. crude stocks rose in week.

text.p: U.S. crude oil stocks held in primary storage rose 5.66 million barrels in the week ended Oct 18 to 304.88 million barrels from a revised 299.21 million barrels that was previously reported as 301.89 million the prior week, the American Petroleum Institute (API) said Tuesday.
API said that crude stocks excluding PADD 5 (Petroleum Administration for Defense District) rose 3.04 million barrels in the week to 236.42 million barrels.
Distillate stocks fell 17,000 barrels to 114.30 million from 114.32 million the previous week. PADD 1 distillate stocks rose 2.47 million barrels to 40.70 million barrels.
API said gasoline stocks fell 5.96 million barrels in the week to 189.84 million barrels from 195.81 million barrels. Percent of capacity rose to 93.1 percent from 92.7 percent.
API said reformulated gasoline stocks (RFG) fell 1.71 million barrels to 37.50 million barrels from 39.21 million barrels in the previous week.
API said crude runs to processing units rose to 14.14 million barrels from 14.10 million barrels.
Residual fuel stocks in the latest week rose to 37.30 million barrels from 36.96 million in the previous week, and crude oil imports rose to 8.13 million barrels per day from 7.27 million, API said.
